recipe_name: Fried squid and courgette with green olive and sun-dried tomato tapenade
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: For the fried squid and courgette, pour the vegetable oil into a frying pan to a depth of 1cm/Â½in and heat until a small cube of bread sizzles and turns golden when dropped into it. (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous. Do not leave unattended.) Place the flour into a bowl, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and a pinch of cayenne pepper and stir. Dip the squid rings into the seasoned flour to coat, shaking off any excess, and fry for 2-3 minutes, or until golden-brown and crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. Repeat the process with the courgette pieces. For the tapenade, place the sun-dried tomatoes, olives and oil into a small food processor, season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and blend until smooth. To serve, place the fried squid rings and courgette onto a plate with a small bowl of tapenade.
ingredients: vegetable oil, for frying,  110g/4oz plain flour ,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  pinch cayenne pepper,  2 small squid, cleaned and sliced into rings,  1 courgette, sliced into rounds,  5 sun-dried tomatoes,  7 green olives, stones removed,  1 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
